translation.en: -Mr. Szpilman? -Hello.
I came specially to meet you. I love your playing.
-Who are you? -My name's Dorota, Jurek's sister.
translation.it: - Lei è? - Dorota. Sono la sorella di Jurek.

translation.en: -You're bleeding! -It's nothing.
You can write him a fan letter later. This isn't the best time. Come on.
translation.it: Vieni, Dorota. Questo non è proprio il momento adatto.

translation.en: Jurek, where have you been hiding her?
-[father] I don't know what to take. -[mother] You always take too much.
[Regina] How many suitcases are you taking? [Halina] I'm packing my red dress.
translation.it: - Quante valigie porti? - Porto l'abito rosso.

translation.en: [father] And what, what do you think, should I, should I take uncle Szymon's portrait? [siren wails in background]
translation.it: Devo portare la foto dello zio Szymon?

translation.en: Take it, don't take it, take what you like.
translation.it: Porta pure quello che ti pare!

translation.en: -Can't you see I'm worried sick? -Oh... He'll come home, he'll be alright.
translation.it: Non vedi che sono in pena? Tornerà a casa, vedrai.

translation.en: [Halina] We should have another case just for shoes.
translation.it: Una valigia è per le scarpe.

translation.en: Wladek, oh! Mama, Wladek's home!
translation.it: Una valigia è per le scarpe. Mamma, Wladek è tornato!

translation.en: Oh! Thank God. Wladek! You're wounded?
translation.it: Grazie al cielo! - Sei ferito. - No.

translation.en: No, no, no, it's a little cut, it's nothing.
Oh, I've been worried sick.
I told her not to worry. You had your papers on you.
translation.it: - Ero preoccupata. - Avevi i documenti. Se una bomba ti avesse colpito ti avrebbero portato qui.

translation.en: If you'd been hit by a bomb, they'd have known where to take you.
translation.it: Se una bomba ti avesse colpito ti avrebbero portato qui.

translation.en: -[Halina laughs] -Henryk, Henryk, don't say things like... don't say things like that.
-[father] I can't find anything. -God forbid. God forbid.
-Papa, Wladek's home. -What did I tell you?
translation.it: Wladek è qui! Che vi dicevo?

translation.en: -[Wladek] What are you doing? -[Regina] What's it look like we're doing?
I don't know they bombed us, we're off the air.
Warsaw's not the only radio station.
translation.it: A Varsavia ci sono altre radio.

translation.en: Ah? Pack, pack, darling. Get your things, pack.
translation.it: A Varsavia ci sono altre radio. Forza, fa' le valigie!

translation.en: -Where are we going? -Pfff. Out of Warsaw.
-Out of Warsaw where? -[Regina] You haven't heard?
-Heard what? -Haven't you seen the paper?
-Oh, where's the paper? -I used it for packing. [sirens wail nearby]
[father] The government's moved to Lublin.
translation.it: Il governo ora è a Lublino.

translation.en: All able bodied men must leave the city,
translation.it: Il governo ora è a Lublino. Gli uomini devono creare

translation.en: go across the river and set up a new line of defense, that's what it said.
translation.it: Gli uomini devono creare una nuova linea difensiva.

translation.en: There's hardly anybody left in this building only the women the men have gone.
translation.it: In questo edificio sono rimaste solo donne.

translation.en: And what do you think you'll do while you're setting up a new line of defense?
translation.it: Mentre si crea la difesa, voi che farete?

translation.en: -Wonder around lugging your suitcases? -[mother] Pack, Wladek. There's no time.
translation.it: Farete le valigie? - Muoviti! - Io non parto.

translation.en: -I'm not going anywhere. -Good! I'm not going anywhere either!
[mother] Don't be ridiculous, we've got to keep together.
No, no, look, look. If I'm going to die, I prefer to die in my own home, staying put.
translation.it: Se devo morire, voglio che accada a casa mia.

translation.en: -[mother] God forbid. -Sssh! Shut up! I've got something listen.
[radio announcer] ...from the BBC in London.
The British government... having received no reply to the ultimatum presented...
translation.it: Il governo britannico, non avendo ricevuto risposta all'ultimatum dato al governo tedesco,

translation.en: to the German government...
has declared war on Nazi Germany.
translation.it: ha dichiarato guerra alla Germania nazista.

translation.en: -Oh, oh, that's wonderful! Wonderful! -[radio announcer] It is expected that...
[radio announcer] ...within the next few hours,
France will make a similar declaration.
translation.it: la Francia prenderà una posizione analoga.

translation.en: Poland is no longer alone.
translation.it: La Polonia non è più sola.

translation.en: [father] It's great, great, wonderful, wonderful!
-Mama, that was a great dinner. -[Wladek] Hm! Yes, it certainly was.
Well when there's something to celebrate, you've got to make an effort.
translation.it: Era il minimo, c'è tanto da festeggiare.

translation.en: Here's to Great Britain and France!
[father] I told you. Didn't I tell you? All will be well.
translation.it: Cosa vi avevo detto? Andrà tutto bene!

translation.en: -[all] Hey! -[father] Oh! [laughs]
Five thousand and three.
Is that all?
Yes, five thousand and three zlotys, that's all we've got left.
It's three thousand and three zlotys too much. Look...
[Regina] "Re: Further restrictions regarding liquid assets.
Jews will be allowed to keep a maximum of two thousand zlotys in their homes."
translation.it: gli ebrei potranno tenere in casa fino a 2000 zloty."

translation.en: -[mother] What do we do with the rest? -Deposit it in a bank. A blocked account.
translation.it: Che facciamo del resto? Lo depositate in banca.

translation.en: Banks?! Who'd be stupid enough to deposit money in a German bank?
translation.it: Chi depositerebbe i propri contanti in una banca tedesca?

translation.en: We could hide the money. Look here. We can hide the money under the flower pot.
translation.it: Nascondiamoli qui! Mettiamoli sotto il vaso.

translation.en: No, no, no. I'll tell you what we'll do. We'll use try and tested methods.
You know what we did in the last war?
We made a hole in the table leg... [taps the table leg] and we hid the money in there.
translation.it: Bucavamo la gamba del tavolo e ci mettevamo i soldi.

translation.en: -And suppose they take the table away? -What do you mean take the table away?
translation.it: Se prendono il tavolo? Come, prendono il tavolo?

translation.en: The Germans go into Jewish homes and they just take what they want...
translation.it: Come, prendono il tavolo? I tedeschi lo fanno.

translation.en: furniture, valuables, anything.
translation.it: Prendono ciò che vogliono dalle case.

translation.en: -[mother] Do they? -Idiot! What would they want with a table. Hey? A table like this?
translation.it: Che se ne farebbero di un tavolo?

translation.en: -What on earth are you doing? -No, listen, look.
[Halina] This is the best place for it.
[Halina] No-one would think of looking under the flowerpot.
No, no. No, no. Listen, listen, I've been thinking--
Oh! Really? That's a change.
-You know what we do? We use psychology. -[Wladek] We use what?
We leave the money and the watch on the table...
and we cover it like this. In full view.
The Germans will search high and low, I promise you, they'll never notice.
translation.it: Ma sei scemo? Non ci faranno caso!

translation.en: That's the stupidest thing I've ever seen. Of course they'll notice it. Look.
translation.it: È una sciocchezza! Ci faranno caso eccome!

translation.en: Look here... Idiot.
[Henryk laughs] And you call me stupid.
No, that is very good because that is the last place--
-This would take hours. -We are not in a hurry. We'd get it back.
translation.it: Ci vorranno ore. Non c'è fretta.

translation.en: -It won't take hours. -How will you get them out? Tell me that!
Tell me that, I would like to know. How would you get them out? -Why do you resist? -[Regina] Quiet! Order, please!
-You take each one out individually. -[Regina] Order please!
Quiet, please, quiet! Order, order, please!
-She's a lawyer, she likes order. -Listen, just listen. Look,
translation.it: Si vede che è un avvocato. Metteremo l'orologio sotto il vaso,

translation.en: the watch we put under the flowerpots and the money we stuff in the violin.
translation.it: Metteremo l'orologio sotto il vaso, i soldi nel violino.

translation.en: -Will I still be able to play? -Well, you'll find out.
-Jurek? It's Wladek Szpilman. -Wladek, how are you?
Fine, fine, we're fine, thank you. And you?
Fine, we're fine under the circumstances. But I guess what you've called about.
translation.it: Bene, data la situazione. So perché chiami.

translation.en: There's nothing we can do. They won't re-open the station. Just won't re-open the station.
translation.it: Niente da fare, la radio non riaprirà.

translation.en: Yes, I know, but um, Jurek--
Not even music, nothing, no radios for the Poles.
translation.it: Niente musica né radio per noi polacchi.

translation.en: I know, Jurek!
But I'm sure you'll find work. A pianist like you Wladek!
translation.it: - Lo so. - Te la caverai. Un pianista come te...

translation.en: Well, maybe, maybe not, but um...
listen, don't be offended, but I didn't call to discuss my future career.
translation.it: Spero di non offenderti, ma ho chiamato per un altro motivo.

translation.en: I nagged Jurek for weeks and weeks, and at last he gave in and said...
translation.it: L'ho tormentato così tanto che Jurek mi ha detto di venire alla radio.

translation.en: "All right, come with me tomorrow", And so I came and...
translation.it: che Jurek mi ha detto di venire alla radio. Ma quello stesso giorno l'hanno bombardata.

translation.en: they bombed the station.
translation.it: Ma quello stesso giorno l'hanno bombardata.

translation.en: I tell you, meeting you like that was absolutely wonderful.
-Really? -Yes, it was... It was unforgettable.
I've always loved your playing, Mr. Szpilman.
-No-one plays Chopin like you. -I hope that's a compliment.
translation.it: Nessuno suona Chopin come lei. Spero che sia seria.

translation.en: -Of course, I mean it. -I was... trying to be funny.
translation.it: Certo che lo sono! Stavo scherzando.

translation.en: Shall we go to the Paradiso, have a coffee?
I'd like that.
-And you, what do you do? -I finished with the conservatoire.
translation.it: Di che ti occupi? Ho finito il conservatorio.

translation.en: -You're a musician? -Yes. But only just.
-What instrument? -The cello.
I love to see a women playing the cello.
translation.it: Mi piacciono le donne che suonano.

translation.en: Here we are.
NO JEWS
This is disgraceful. How dare they?
You know what people are like, they want to be better Nazis than Hitler.
translation.it: Cercano di essere dei bravi nazisti.

translation.en: -I'm going in there to complain. -No. It's better not, believe me.
translation.it: Voglio fare chiarezza. Lascia stare, è meglio.

translation.en: -It's so humiliating. Someone like you! -[woman] Good-bye!
We'll find somewhere else.
-[Dorota] We can walk in the park. -No, we can't.
It's an official decree. No Jews allowed in the park.
translation.it: Decreto ufficiale: niente ebrei nel parco.

translation.en: -My God. Are you joking? -I'm not joking, it's true.
I suggest we just sit on a bench somewhere but that's another official decree,
translation.it: Come pure le panchine, dove gli ebrei non possono sedersi.

translation.en: "no Jews allowed on public benches".
translation.it: dove gli ebrei non possono sedersi.

translation.en: This is absurd!
I'll tell you what we can do. We can just stand here and talk.
I think we're allowed to do that, don't you?
translation.it: Dubito che questo ci sia vietato.

translation.en: So, you play the cello Dorota. That's nice.
And who's your favorite composer? Chopin? Really? Well...
translation.it: E chi è il tuo preferito? Chopin?

translation.en: you'll have to learn to play his cello sonata, won't you?
translation.it: Devi imparare ad eseguirlo al violoncello.

translation.en: And what about you, Wladek? Well...
Perhaps I could accompany you. Me on the piano, you on the cello.
Oh, Mr. Szpilman, you're quite, quite wonderful.
translation.it: Signor Szpilman, lei è un uomo meraviglioso.

translation.en: Call me Wladek, please.
"Re: emblems for Jews in the Warsaw district.
translation.it: Ascoltate: "Emblemi per gli ebrei a Varsavia."

translation.en: I hereby order that all Jews in the Warsaw district...
translation.it: "Da questo momento in poi ogni ebreo a Varsavia

translation.en: will wear visible emblems when out of doors.
translation.it: dovrà circolare con un emblema ben visibile.

translation.en: This decree will come into force on the 1st of December, 1939...
translation.it: Tale decreto entrerà in vigore dal primo dicembre 1939

translation.en: and applies to all Jews over 12 years of age.
translation.it: ed includerà tutti gli ebrei dai 12 anni in su.

translation.en: The emblem will be worn on the right sleeve...
translation.it: L'emblema sarà posto sulla manica destra.

translation.en: and will represent a blue star of David on a white background.
translation.it: Raffigurerà una stella di Davide su fondo bianco.

translation.en: The background must be sufficiently large...
translation.it: Il fondo sarà tanto ampio da contenere

translation.en: for the star to measure eight centimeters from point to point.
translation.it: una stella che misuri otto centimetri da punta a punta.

translation.en: The width of the arms of the star must be one centimeter.
translation.it: Le punte della stella misureranno un centimetro.

translation.en: The Jews that do not respect this decree will be severely punished.
translation.it: Gli ebrei che non rispetteranno il decreto saranno puniti."

translation.en: Governor of Warsaw district, Dr. Fischer."
translation.it: Il Governatore di Varsavia, Dottor Fischer.

translation.en: I won't wear it.
I won't wear it. I'm not going to be branded.
translation.it: Nemmeno io, non mi farò marchiare.

translation.en: [clears throat] Let, let me see this.
Does it say that we have to provide these armbands ourselves?
translation.it: Specifica se le fasce dobbiamo procurarcele noi?

translation.en: -Where will we get them? -We're not going to get them.
translation.it: - Dove le prendiamo? - Non le prendiamo!

translation.en: We're not going to wear them!
[in German] You!
[in German] Come here.
[in German] Why didn't you bow?
[in German] I beg your pardon.
[in German] You're forbidden to walk on the pavement.
[in German] Walk in the gutter!
-Have you seen this? -What, what, what? I'm working. What?
What is it?
-That's where they're going to put us. -What do you mean, put us?
translation.it: È qui che ci metteranno. Che vuoi dire?

translation.en: "By order of the governor of the Warsaw district, Dr. Fischer...
translation.it: "Per ordine di Fischer, Governatore di Varsavia,

translation.en: concerning the establishment of the Jewish district in Warsaw.
translation.it: circa l'istituzione del quartiere ebreo in città:

translation.en: There will be created a Jewish district in which all Jews living in Warsaw
translation.it: sarà istituito un quartiere dove tutti gli ebrei

translation.en: or moving to Warsaw will have to reside."
Look here. "Jews living outside of the prescribed area
translation.it: Senti questa. "Gli ebrei che vivono altrove

translation.en: will have to move to the Jewish district by 31st of October, 1940."
translation.it: dovranno trasferirsi nel quartiere entro il 31 ottobre... ...1940."

translation.en: They won't get all of us. It's too small. There's 400 thousand of us in Warsaw.
translation.it: Non ci entreremo tutti. Qui siamo in quattrocentomila.

translation.en: No, 360 thousand. So it will be easy.
Mama, what is it?
[mother cries] 20 zlotys!
That's all we have left, 20 zlotys.
What, what can I buy with 20 zlotys?
I am sick of cooking potatoes, potatoes, potatoes.
translation.it: Sono stufa di cucinare sempre patate!

translation.en: That's the price. That's what I'm offering.
My advice is to accept. You won't get more from anyone else.
translation.it: Accettate, nessuno vi offrirà di più.

translation.en: -But, it's a Bechstein, Mr. Lipa! -Two thousand. My advice is to take it.
translation.it: Ma è un Bechstein! Duemila. Prendere o lasciare.

translation.en: [Mr. Lipa] What are you going to do when you're hungry? Eat the piano?
-Get out! -Hey! What's the matter with you?
-Stop it! -We'd rather give it away. Go on, get out!
Haven't you eaten today? Hm? What you suffering from?
translation.it: Preferiamo regalarlo! Che ti prende, eh?

translation.en: You people are crazy.
I'm doing you a favor. Two thousand and I'm paying for the removal.
translation.it: Vi faccio un favore. Duemila e il trasporto lo pago io!

translation.en: I'm not even charging for the removal!
translation.it: Duemila e il trasporto lo pago io!

translation.en: You haven't eaten today. You're crazy.
Take it.
I didn't want to come.
I didn't want to see all this, but... I couldn't stop myself.
translation.it: Non volevo vedere tutto questo, ma... Non ho potuto evitarlo.

translation.en: -How are you doing? -Fine.
No, not really. They arrested my cousin.
translation.it: Non è vero. Hanno preso mio cugino.

translation.en: Jurek says they'll let him out.
-This is disgraceful. -It won't last long. Don't worry.
translation.it: È vergognoso. Non durerà per molto, vedrai.

translation.en: That's what I said myself.
It's too absurd.
Well, I'll, I'll see you...
soon.
Good-bye.
to tell you the truth, I thought it would be worse.
translation.it: Ad essere sincero, mi aspettavo di peggio.

translation.en: -Where will we sleep? -I sleep in the kitchen with the girls.
translation.it: Come dormiremo? Le ragazze ed io staremo in cucina,

translation.en: You, Henryk and papa, in here.
Look.
Come and look.
Papa! Papa! Papa!
-Sell anything? -Just one. Dostoievski, The Idiot.
translation.it: - Venduto niente? - Solo L'idiota di Dostoevskij.

translation.en: -Three zlotys. -It's better than yesterday.
Three lousy zlotys. And there are people there making millions.
translation.it: Tre miseri zloty. - C'è chi si arricchisce, qui. - Lo so.

translation.en: -I know. -You don't know, believe me.
translation.it: - C'è chi si arricchisce, qui. - Lo so. Non che non lo sai!

translation.en: They bribe the guards, the guards turn a blind eye.
translation.it: Pagano le guardie perché chiudano un occhio.

translation.en: They're bringing in cartloads of food, tobacco, liquor, French cosmetics.
translation.it: Così smerciano cibo, tabacco, liquori, cosmetici francesi,

translation.en: And the poor are dying all around and they don't give a damn.
Excuse me, have you seen my husband, Izaak Szerman?
translation.it: Ha visto mio marito Izaak Szerman?

translation.en: A tall, a tall handsome man, with a little gray beard... No?
translation.it: È un uomo alto e attraente con la barba grigia.

translation.en: -I'm afraid not. -Excuse me. Good-bye.
translation.it: - Temo di no. - Scusi. Addio e dorma bene!

translation.en: Sleep well. But, but, but if you see him, write to me, yes?
translation.it: Addio e dorma bene! Se lo vede, me lo faccia sapere!

translation.en: Izaak Szerman.
Why do we have to have a gentile street running through our area?
translation.it: Questa strada pagana attraversa la nostra area!

translation.en: Why can't they go around?
Don't worry about it. They're about to build a bridge. Haven't you heard?
translation.it: Non si preoccupi, stanno per costruire un ponte.

translation.en: A bridge, a bridge a smedge.
[Jewish man] The Germans claim to be intelligent.
But do you know what I think? I think they are totally stupid.
translation.it: Ma io dico che sono solo degli idioti.

translation.en: I have a family to feed. I spend half of my time here
translation.it: Ho una famiglia da sfamare, eppure passo metà giornata ad aspettare qui.

translation.en: waiting for them to let us through.
translation.it: eppure passo metà giornata ad aspettare qui.

translation.en: [Jewish man] Maybe they think I come here to listen to the music?
translation.it: Credono che venga a sentire la musica?

translation.en: [speaking German]
[in German] You're cold?
[speaking German]
[in German] Dance!
[in German] Come on, come on! Dance!
[speaking German]
translation.it: Ma che bravo! Tu vuoi ballare?

translation.en: [speaking German]
translation.it: Forza, liberate la piazza, gli ebrei devono ballare!

translation.en: [speaking German]
[in German] Faster!
[soldiers speaking German]
translation.it: Dovete muovervi più velocemente! Guarda gli ebrei!

translation.en: [soldiers speaking German] [whistle blows]
[mother] Good, they're here.
Yitzchak Heller's been waiting for you.
-What's this about? -[mother] Sit down, have tea.
[mother] I'll start lunch when the girls get here.
-[Henryk] So, what are you doing here? -[father] He brought cakes.
translation.it: Che ci fai qui? Ha portato dei dolci.

translation.en: His ah... his father's back in the jewelery business.
translation.it: Suo padre è di nuovo gioielliere.

translation.en: He's, uh, doing well, hey, Yitzchak, hey?
[father] Amazing, jewelery.
-We're recruiting. -Who is recruiting?
Don't be clever with me, Henryk. I'm coming as a friend.
translation.it: Non essere sciocco, vengo da amico.

translation.en: [Heller] They're bringing Jews in from all over the country.
Soon there will be half million people in the ghetto.
translation.it: Presto saremo tanti, ci vorrà più polizia.

translation.en: -We need more Jewish police. -Oh! More Jewish police!
translation.it: Presto saremo tanti, ci vorrà più polizia. Polizia ebrea?

translation.en: You mean you want me to beat up Jews with my truncheon and catch the Gestapo spirit.
translation.it: Vuoi che picchi gli ebrei come fa la Gestapo?

translation.en: -[Henryk] I see! -Someone's got to do it, Henryk. [Henryk] But why me?
I thought you only recruited boys with rich fathers.
translation.it: Non reclutate i figli dei ricchi?

translation.en: Look at my father, look at us, I mean.
Yes, I'm looking at you, that's why I'm here. Your whole family can have a better life.
translation.it: Sì, e sono qui proprio per aiutarvi.

translation.en: You want to go on struggling for survival, selling books on the street?
Yes, please.
[scoffs] I'm doing you people a favor.
What about you, Wladek? You're a great pianist. And we've got an excellent police jazz band.
translation.it: Wladek, tu potresti unirti alla banda della polizia.

translation.en: They'd welcome you with open arms. Join us!
-[Heller] You've got no work. -Thank you, I've got work.
translation.it: Ti accoglierebbero con entusiasmo! Io ho già un lavoro.

translation.en: Yes of course!
I'm sorry, Wladek, he wants you to stop.
[continues playing] Who wants me to stop?
[Jehuda] I always say, look on the bright side.
[Jehuda] You're in a small ghetto with intellectuals, professional people.
[Jehuda] You're better off than us. Here in the large ghetto it's a cesspool.
translation.it: sei meglio di noi. - Questa è solo una fogna. - Fammi fare qualcosa.

translation.en: Jehuda, give me something to do.
translation.it: - Questa è solo una fogna. - Fammi fare qualcosa.

translation.en: You're an artist, Wladek. You keep peoples' spirits up. You do enough.
translation.it: Il tuo lavoro è tenere su gli animi della gente!

translation.en: -I want to help, I want to do something. -You're too well known, Wladek.
translation.it: Ma voglio aiutarvi! Sei troppo conosciuto, e c'è dell'altro.

translation.en: And you know what? You musicians don't make good conspirators.
translation.it: Sei troppo conosciuto, e c'è dell'altro. Voi musicisti non sapete cospirare.

translation.en: You're too... too... musical. [laughs]
-Who is that? -Symche.
[Symche] Majorek.
[Wladek] There are notices going up. City is to be cleansed of undesirables.
translation.it: Ripuliranno la città dalle persone sgradite.

translation.en: -No notices going up. -[Majorek] Hello, Symche.
Dolek... Mrs. Zyskind.
[Majorek] Jehuda, working hard?
Majorek. This is the greatest pianist in Poland. Maybe the whole world.
translation.it: Majorek, ti presento un grande pianista. Il più grande.

translation.en: Wladyslaw Szpilman, meet Majorek.
-How do you do? -I know your name.
-I've never heard you play. -[Jehuda] Majorek used to be in the Army.
translation.it: Mi piacerebbe sentirti suonare. Majorek era soldato.

translation.en: Brilliant man. The only thing I've got against him is he's not a socialist.
translation.it: Ha un solo difetto, non è socialista.

translation.en: [Jehuda] You better go now, Wladek. It's nearly curfew.
translation.it: Devi andare, si avvicina il coprifuoco.

translation.en: [Jehuda] You know how many copies we print of our newspaper?
[Jehuda] Five hundred.
You know how many people on average read one copy? Twenty.
translation.it: Quante persone leggono il giornale, in media? Venti.

translation.en: That makes ten thousand readers. These will start the uprising.
translation.it: Fanno diecimila lettori. Ci sarà un'insurrezione.

translation.en: Majorek hides them in his underpants and leaves them in toilets.
translation.it: Majorek nasconde le copie del giornale nei bagni.

translation.en: -Toilets, huh? -As many toilets as I can find.
Germans never use Jewish toilets.
translation.it: I tedeschi non usano i bagni ebrei.

translation.en: -They're too clean for them. -[Jehuda laughs]
[man shouts in German]
[man in German] Hold it! You little bastard! [screaming continues]
[Wladek] Stop it! Stop it!
[Wladek] Come on, come on, come on. Come on boy.
Stand up. Stand up. Stand up!
[man speaks in German]
Please, tonight for once, I don't want anything bad talked about.
translation.it: Vi prego, almeno per stasera, di evitare argomenti tristi.

translation.en: -Enjoy our meal. -Fine, then I'll tell you something funny.
translation.it: Buon appetito. Vi racconto cos'è successo al dottor Raszeja.

translation.en: You all know who I mean by Dr. Raszeja?
translation.it: Vi racconto cos'è successo al dottor Raszeja.

translation.en: -The surgeon. -[Henryk] The surgeon.
[Henryk] Well, for some reason, don't ask me why,
the Germans allowed him into the ghetto to perform an operation.
On a Jew? They let a Pole to come in to operate on a Jew?
translation.it: Ebreo? Un polacco che opera un ebreo?

translation.en: He got a pass, that's all I know. Anyway, so he...
translation.it: So solo che era stato autorizzato.

translation.en: he puts the patient to sleep and starts the operation.
He'd just made the first incision when the SS burst in...
translation.it: Dopo poco le SS fanno irruzione,

translation.en: shoot the patient lying on the table, then Dr. Raszeja and everybody else who was there.
translation.it: sparano al paziente, al dottore e a tutti i presenti.

translation.en: Isn't that a laugh?
The patient didn't feel a thing, he was anesthetized. [laughs]
I said nothing bad, Henryk.
What's the matter with you all, huh? Huh? You lost your sense of humor?
translation.it: Che vi prende? Avete perso l'umorismo?

translation.en: It's not funny.
Well, you know what's funny? You're funny, with that ridiculous tie.
translation.it: Fai ridere tu con quella ridicola cravatta!

translation.en: What are you talking about my tie for? What's my tie have to do with anything?
-[Wladek] I need this tie for my work. -Your work?
translation.it: - La metto per il lavoro. - Lavoro?

translation.en: -Yes, that's right, I work. -Yes, yes, your work.
translation.it: Io lavoro! Suoni il piano per i parassiti del ghetto!

translation.en: Playing the piano for all the parasites in the ghetto.
translation.it: Suoni il piano per i parassiti del ghetto!

translation.en: -Parasites? -Parasites.
Boys. Boys!
They don't give a damn about people's sufferings.
And you blame me for their apathy, right?
I do because I see it every day.
translation.it: Sarebbe colpa mia? Io vedo la sofferenza ogni giorno!

translation.en: They don't even notice what's going around them.
translation.it: Io vedo la sofferenza ogni giorno!

translation.en: -I blame the Americans. -For what? For my tie?
The American Jews, and there are lots of them.
What have they done for us, hey? What do they think they're doing?
translation.it: Cos'hanno fatto per noi? Qui la gente muore,

translation.en: People here are dying. Haven't got a bite to eat.
translation.it: Cos'hanno fatto per noi? Qui la gente muore, non ha niente da mangiare.

translation.en: The Jewish bankers over there should be persuading America
to declare war on Germany. [car tires squeal] [engine revs]
translation.it: dovrebbero dire agli americani di intervenire.

translation.en: [whispers] Lights! Lights!
[SS Officer] Stand up!
[SS Officer] You, stand up! Come on!
[SS Officer] Throw him out!
[SS Officer speaking German]
-I'm Mr. Szpilman's sister. -Yes, come in. Not you!
translation.it: - Devo vedere Szpilman. - Entri. Voi no!

translation.en: -What's happened? -Oh my God, it's terrible.
-What? -They're hunting people in the streets. They've taken Henryk.
translation.it: Danno la caccia alla gente. Hanno preso Henryk.

translation.en: All right, go home, alright? Go home, I'll take care of it.
translation.it: Calma, torna a casa, ci penso io.

translation.en: Excuse me. Have you seen my husband? Izaak Szerman?
translation.it: Ha visto per caso mio marito Izaak Szerman?

translation.en: -No, I'm afraid not. -Tall, handsome, a little gray beard.
translation.it: Temo di no. È un bell'uomo, alto e con la barba grigia.

translation.en: If you see him, write to me. Don't forget. Izaak Szerman.
translation.it: Se lo vede, mi faccia sapere.

translation.en: [Jewish police in German] Faster, keep moving! Run!
What happened here?
They've got my grandson in there. They pick them up, they take them away.
translation.it: Hanno preso mio nipote assieme a tanti altri.

translation.en: What they do to them, I've stopped believing in God.
translation.it: Cosa gli faranno? Ho smesso di credere in Dio.

translation.en: Excuse me. Excuse me.
[Wladek] Yitzchak?
Yitzchak? Yitzchak, here, it's Wladek Szpilman!
-Henryk's in there. -I haven't seen him.
translation.it: Henryk è lì. Non l'ho visto.

translation.en: -Believe me. They picked him up. -[Heller] Tough luck!
Can you help?
Oh, now you need me, yes, now you need me!
translation.it: Ora vieni a chiedere il mio aiuto.

translation.en: Can you help us?
-It costs. -I have no money.
Then there's nothing I can do. You should've joined us when you had the chance.
translation.it: Allora non posso fare niente per te.

translation.en: -Yitzchak they told me you had influence. -Who told you?
translation.it: Si dice che tu sia influente. Chi lo dice?

translation.en: People, people I know. They said you're an important man.
[Rubinstein speaking Yiddish]
-[1st Shupo] Who is this? -[2nd Shupo] Good morning Herr Rubinstein.
-[1st Shupo] Good morning. -[Rubinstein speaking Yiddish]
translation.it: Salve, Signor Rubinstein. Un bandito! Boom, boom!

translation.en: -[Rubinstein] Kaputt. Kaputt. -[German officers laugh]
-[Officers speaking German] -[Rubinstein speaking Yiddish]
translation.it: La guerra fa paura! Rubinstein si merita una sigaretta.

translation.en: -[2nd Shupo] Want a cigarette? -[Rubinstein] Cigarette? Mmm.
translation.it: Rubinstein si merita una sigaretta. Le sigarette!

translation.en: [Rubinstein in German] Thank you.
[Rubinstein speaking Yiddish]
translation.it: - Siamo uguali! - Certo. Ma noi tedeschi lo siamo di più.

translation.en: -[2nd Shupo speaking German] -[both laugh]
translation.it: Ma noi tedeschi lo siamo di più.

translation.en: [Rubinstein speaking Yiddish]
Help! Help! Help! Help! A snatcher! A snatcher! Help, help me!
-Why did they pick you up? -So you go to Yitzchak Heller?
translation.it: Che hai fatto? Hai chiesto aiuto a Yitzchak?

translation.en: -Did I ask you to talk to him? -You're out, aren't you?
translation.it: Perché l'hai fatto? T'ho fatto uscire.

translation.en: Did you beg, did you grovel to that piece of shit, that cockroach?
translation.it: Sei andato ad elemosinare da quel farabutto?

translation.en: I didn't grovel, I asked him to help you.
translation.it: Sei andato ad elemosinare da quel farabutto? Ho solo chiesto.

translation.en: What did you pay him?
With what, with what could I pay him? With what?
Every zloty I earn we spend on food.
-I can look after myself. -They were taking you away.
translation.it: - Non volevo aiuto. - Ti avevano preso!

translation.en: It's got nothing to do with you. It's me they wanted, not you.
translation.it: Non sono affari tuoi! Volevano me, non te!

translation.en: Why do you have to interfere with other people's business?
translation.it: Perché devi sempre metterti in mezzo?

translation.en: You're mad. That's, that's your trouble, is your mad.
That's also my business.
Hey, hey! What's the matter? What's the matter? Are you sick?
Hungry.
Employment certificate? What's that mean, no employment certificate?
translation.it: A che serve un permesso di lavoro?

translation.en: You have to have an employment certificate...
to work for one of the German firms in the ghetto, otherwise...
-Otherwise what? -[Henryk] You'll be deported.
-So the rumors were true. -[Henryk] They're going to resettle us...
translation.it: Le voci erano fondate. Vogliono riorganizzarci.

translation.en: and send us to labor camps, in the East.
translation.it: Ci mandano nei campi di lavoro.

translation.en: -And they're closing the small ghetto. -My God!
[Jehuda] Wladek? Wladek?
I thought you'd be off on tour playing London, Paris, New York, Chicago.
translation.it: Ti credevo in tour a Londra, o a New York.

translation.en: -Not this week. -You look terrible.
Have you heard the rumors? They're going to resettle us in the East.
translation.it: Non sai nulla? Ci mandano tutti all'Est.

translation.en: Rumors! You take it all too much to heart Wladek. What's the trouble?
translation.it: Sono solo dicerie! Che problema hai?

translation.en: I, I've been trying to get the certificate of employment for my father.
translation.it: Devo procurarmi un permesso di lavoro per mio padre.

translation.en: But I managed to get one for me and the rest of my family, but I need another one for my father.
translation.it: Li ho già procurati per tutta la famiglia.

translation.en: -I've been to all the firms and shops... -Why didn't you come to me?
translation.it: Sono stato ovunque. Perché non da me?

translation.en: I didn't know you were in the certificate business. I'm not, but Majorek is.
translation.it: - Non ti credevo nel giro. - Io no, ma Majorek sì.

translation.en: Can you help? I have no money.
Please, don't insult us. Can you do something for him?
translation.it: Così ci offendi! Puoi fare qualcosa?

translation.en: Be at the Schultz workshop tomorrow, four o'clock.
You see what a wonderful piece of luck you've had today?
That's the historical imperative in action! That's why I always say:
translation.it: È l'imperativo storico che ritorna. Guarda il lato positivo!

translation.en: -Look on the bright side! -The bright side, yes, I know.
-[Majorek] How's your back? -Better.
Better?
Better not ask!
-Thank you. -My pleasure. Won't help you anyway.
translation.it: Grazie. Di niente! Ma non vi aiuterà!

translation.en: [Majorek] Thank you, Mr. Schultz.
Well, at least we got work in the ghetto. Hey?
At least we are still together.
All out! Into the yard!
We're all employed. We've got work permits.
translation.it: Noi siamo impiegati, abbiamo il permesso di lavoro.

translation.en: [German NCO in German] Go over there. Hurry.
[German NCO in German] You.
[German NCO in German] You. You.
[German NCO in German] You.
[German NCO in German] You.
[in German] The rest of you, get dressed and report back here!
translation.it: Gli altri vadano a vestirsi, poi tornino qui.

translation.en: Bring your belongings, only 15 kilos!
translation.it: Portate le vostre cose, massimo quindici chili.

translation.en: Where are you taking us?
I'm sorry, I did my best.
I thought the certificates would save us.
Stop it, Wladek.
Let's just hope that Henryk and Halina will be better off.
translation.it: Speriamo solo che Henryk e Halina stiano bene.

translation.en: -Where will we be going? -You're going to work.
You'll be much better off than in the stinking ghetto. Move.
translation.it: Starete meglio che qui nel ghetto.

translation.en: [young woman] Why did I do it? Why did I do it?
Why did I do it?
Don't you have a drop of water? He's dying.
translation.it: Lei non ha un po' d'acqua?

translation.en: My child is dying of thirst.
translation.it: Mio figlio sta morendo di sete, la prego!

translation.en: Don't you have a drop of water? I beg you.
[Dr. Szpilman] Did you hear what I'm saying?
-I'm telling you, it's a disgrace. -I can hear you.
[Dr. Szpilman] We're letting them take us to our death like sheep to the slaughter.
-Not so loud. -[Dr. Szpilman] Why don't we attack them?
There's half a million of us here. We can break out of the ghetto.
translation.it: Siamo mezzo milione qui, scappiamo via!

translation.en: At least we can die honorably, not as a stain on the face of history.
Why are you so sure they're sending us to our death?
translation.it: È sicuro che ci mandino a morire?

translation.en: I'm not sure. You know why I'm not sure? Because they didn't tell me. But I'm telling you, they're going to wipe us all out.
translation.it: No, non lo sono, ma so che vogliono liberarsi di noi.

translation.en: Dr. Ehrlich, what do you want me to do? Do you want me to fight?
To fight, you need organization, plans, guns.
[father] He's right. What do you think I can do? Fight them with my violin bow?
translation.it: È vero, non posso combattere col mio violino!

translation.en: The Germans would never squander a huge labor force like this.
translation.it: I tedeschi non sprecano la forza lavoro.

translation.en: They're sending us to a labor camp, it's obvious.
Oh, sure.
Look at that cripple there, look at the old people, the children.
translation.it: Come no! E quello storpio? I vecchi, i bambini, li faranno lavorare?

translation.en: They're gonna work?
translation.it: I vecchi, i bambini, li faranno lavorare?

translation.en: Look at you! Well, you're going to carry iron girders on your back?
translation.it: Voi trasporterete travi di ferro sulla schiena?

translation.en: Henryk! Halina, Henryk!
We heard you were here. we wanted to be with you!
We wanted to be with you!
[sighs] Stupid. Stupid.
[young woman] Why did I do it? Why did I do it?
She's getting on my nerves.
-What did she do, for God's sake? -She smothered her baby.
translation.it: Ma cos'avrà mai fatto? Ha soffocato il suo bambino.

translation.en: They prepared a hiding place and of course they went there.
But the baby cried just as the police came.
translation.it: La polizia era vicina, il piccolo piangeva.

translation.en: She smothered the cries with her hands, the baby died.
translation.it: Lei voleva reprimerne il pianto e ha finito col soffocarlo.

translation.en: [Grun] A policeman heard the death rattle and found where they were hiding.
translation.it: Un agente ha sentito i lamenti e li ha trovati.

translation.en: What are you reading?
"If you prick us, de we not bleed? If you tickle us, do we not laugh?
translation.it: "Se ci pungete, noi sanguiniamo. Se ci solleticate, noi ridiamo.

translation.en: If you poison us, do we not die?
And, if you wrong us, shall we not revenge?"
translation.it: E se ci maltrattate, noi ci vendicheremo."

translation.en: -Very appropriate. -Yes. That's why I brought it.
Idiot. What's he think he's gonna do with the money?
translation.it: Idiota. Che se ne fa dei soldi?

translation.en: Hey boy, come here.
[father] Come here.
-[father] How much for a caramel? -Twenty zlotys.
What? For one caramel? What do you think you're gonna do with the money?
Twenty zlotys.
We've got 20 between us.
I've got ten, I think.
Five, ten, twenty.
-Halina? -What?
-It's a funny time to say this, but... -What?
translation.it: Forse il momento non è indicato... Per cosa?

translation.en: I wish I knew you better.
Thank you.
[Heller] Szpilman? Szpilman!
Fuck off stupid! Go!
Papa? Papa?
Halina? Mama?
What do you think you're doing Szpilman? I've saved your life. Get out just go! Go!
translation.it: Cosa credi di fare? Ti ho salvato la vita, vattene!

translation.en: [Heller] Don't run!
Mama! Mama! Mama!
-Well, off they go to the melting pot. -Ah! Ja.
translation.it: Ecco che vanno tutti al crogiolo.

translation.en: What are you doing? She's pregnant!
[Benek] Wladek?
[sighs heavily] Why are you here, Wladek?
It's like this, I, I...
We...
All of them, all of them.
Perhaps they're lucky. The quicker, the better.
translation.it: Forse è un bene. Meglio prima che dopo.

translation.en: It's not finished yet. We'll stay here for a couple of days,
translation.it: Dobbiamo restare qui per un paio di giorni.

translation.en: until things die down.
I've bribed a policeman, he'll come when it's over.
translation.it: un poliziotto ci verrà ad avvisare, l'ho pagato.

translation.en: [soldier speaking German]
[soldier speaking German]
My God, I haven't been outside in, it must be two years.
translation.it: Erano due anni che non uscivo fuori.

translation.en: Don't get overexcited.
It's gold. Very good price.
translation.it: È oro! Il prezzo è ottimo!

translation.en: Someone you know?
A beauty. Who is she?
She's a singer. I knew her well actually. Her husband's an actor.
translation.it: È una cantante. La conoscevo bene, il marito è un attore.

translation.en: They're good people. I'd like to talk to her.
Don't forget, Wladek. They hang them for helping Jews.
translation.it: Ricordati che impiccano chi aiuta gli ebrei.

translation.en: [speaking German]
-[SS soldier] Stop! -[soldier] Halt!
[SS soldier speaking German]
[speaking German]
[SS soldier speaking German]
[SS soldier speaking German]
[SS soldier shouting in German]
[SS soldier shouting in German]
[soldier speaking German]
[soldier speaking German]
How long have you been here?
Since last night.
I was pleased to see you.
They're going to start the final resettlement now.
We know what it means.
We sent someone out. Zygmunt, a good man.
translation.it: Uno dei nostri è uscito. Zygmunt, un brav'uomo.

translation.en: His orders were to follow the trains out of Warsaw.
translation.it: Ha seguito i treni in partenza da Varsavia.

translation.en: He got to Sokolow.
A local railway man told him the tracks divided,
translation.it: Lì le rotaie prendono due direzioni.

translation.en: one branch leading to Treblinka.
He said everyday freight trains carrying people from Warsaw...
translation.it: Ogni giorno, treni carichi di gente da Varsavia

translation.en: branched off to Treblinka and returned empty.
translation.it: andavano a Treblinka e tornavano vuoti.

translation.en: No transports of food are ever seen on that line.
translation.it: Lì non viene mai trasportato cibo.

translation.en: And civilians are forbidden to approach the Treblinka station.
translation.it: Ai civili non è permesso recarsi a Treblinka.

translation.en: They're exterminating us.
It won't take them long.
We're 60 thousand left, out of half a million.
Mostly young people.
And this time we're gonna fight.
We're in good shape.
Organized. We're prepared.
If you need help, I...
[Zig-Zag] You! Come here!
Shit!
[Wladek] I'm sorry. I'm sorry.
[Wladek] I, I don't know what I was thinking.
[speaking German]
[in German] Get him away from here.
I hope you play the piano better than you carry bricks.
translation.it: Trasportare mattoni non fa per te.

translation.en: He won't last long if he goes on like this.
I'll see if I can get him something better.
Trouble.
[German soldier # 1 in German] Assemble! Fall in!
[German soldier # 2] Round up! Only the Jews.
[German soldier # 2] Poles go on working. Only the Jews!
translation.it: I polacchi continuino a lavorare! Solo gli ebrei!

translation.en: I have good news for you.
There are rumors going around that we like to, uh...
translation.it: Girano voci circa la nostra intenzione

translation.en: umsiedeln... Resettle you.
I promise you that now and in the future...
translation.it: Sono venuto ad assicurarvi che né ora, né in futuro,

translation.en: nothing else is planned.
Ja? For this reason, we put information posters on the wall.
translation.it: Va bene? Per questo motivo, abbiamo affisso dei manifesti esplicativi.

translation.en: To show you our goodwill...
translation.it: Per mostrarvi le nostre buone intenzioni,

translation.en: you should vote one of you to be allowed...
translation.it: vi autorizziamo a scegliere uno tra voi

translation.en: to go in town daily...
translation.it: che potrà recarsi in città ogni giorno

translation.en: and bring three kilos of Kartoffeln potatoes, ja?
translation.it: e portare con sé tre chili di patate,

translation.en: And one loaf of bread for each of your workers.
translation.it: insieme con un pezzo di pane per ciascuno di voi.

translation.en: So, why should we do something else like this if we would resettle you?
translation.it: Perché mai lo faremmo, se volessimo risistemarvi?

translation.en: You can make good business out of the things you don't eat.
translation.it: Potete anche vendere tutto ciò che non mangiate.

translation.en: Isn't that something that you Jews are good in? Make money?
translation.it: Non siete forse bravi, voi ebrei, a far soldi?

translation.en: [in German] Carry on.
That one, with the string. The others, tied by wire.
translation.it: Quello, con lo spago. Gli altri, con il filo di ferro.

translation.en: [Majorek] Now!
Majorek.
I have a favor to ask.
I want to get out of here.
It's easy to get out. It's how you survive on the other side that's hard.
translation.it: Uscire è facile. Il problema è sopravvivere.

translation.en: I know.
Last summer, I worked for a day in the Zelazna Brama Square.
translation.it: L'estate scorsa ho lavorato in piazza Zelazna Brama.

translation.en: I saw someone I knew, she's an old friend.
translation.it: Lì ho visto una mia vecchia amica.

translation.en: A singer, her husband's an actor.
translation.it: Fa la cantante, il marito è attore.

translation.en: I filled their names down and their address, if they're still there.
translation.it: Ho scritto nome e indirizzo. Se abitano ancora lì.

translation.en: Janina Godlewska and Andrzej Bogucki. They're good people.
translation.it: Janina Godlewska e Andrzej Bogucki. Sono brave persone.

translation.en: Would you try to make contact?
You go to town every day.
Would you just ask them, ask them if they'd help me get out of here?
translation.it: Puoi chiedere loro se mi aiutano ad uscire?

translation.en: [in German] Got a plaster?
[in German] What are you up to?
What's in that?
[in German] We're allowed to take food into the ghetto.
translation.it: Siamo autorizzati a portare del cibo nel ghetto.

translation.en: [in German] Three kilos of potato and bread.
translation.it: Tre chili di patate e del pane.

translation.en: [in German] Open it.
[in German] It's only potatoes and bread.
[in German] You're lying. I can smell it.
[in German] Open it.
[in German] Potatoes!
[in German] You Jews are all the same.
[in German] Give a Jew your little finger...
translation.it: Se vi si dà un dito,

translation.en: and he takes the whole hand.
translation.it: voi vi prendete tutta la mano!

translation.en: [in German] Lie to me again, I'll shoot you... personally.
translation.it: Mentimi di nuovo e giuro che ti ammazzo con le mie mani.

translation.en: [Majorek] I tried your friends.
-They don't live there anymore. -Did you make contact?
translation.it: Non vivono più lì. Hai qualche contatto?

translation.en: -Be ready to leave. -When?
-Soon. -[Zig-Zag] Halt!
-[soldier speaking German] -[Wladek] Oh, shit! Shit!
[soldier speaking German] [Zig-Zag speaking German as he whips the Jews]
[in German] I'll teach you discipline, you dirty pigs!
translation.it: Vi insegnerò la disciplina, sporchi ebrei!

translation.en: [in German] Know why we're beating you?
[in German] Know why we beat you?
-[in German] Why? -[in German] To celebrate New Year's Eve.
No, quick march! March!
[Zig-Zag in German] March and sing!
[Zig-Zag in German] Sing something cheerful!
[Zig-Zag in German] Sing it loud and clear! [laughs]
[Column sings] ♪ Hey ranks unite and follow the white eagle ♪
translation.it: Truppe, unitevi E seguite l'aquila bianca!

translation.en: [all sing] ♪ Stand up and fight our mortal enemies ♪
♪ Riflemen, hey! Let's give them fire and brimstone ♪
♪ We'll blow away the yoke of slavery ♪
translation.it: E spezziamo Le catene della schiavitù

translation.en: ♪ Punish and rout the rapists of our nation ♪
translation.it: Puniamo chiunque violenti la nostra nazione!

translation.en: ♪ We'll smash the knout to save our dignity ♪
translation.it: Li colpiremo E salveremo la nostra dignità!

translation.en: I'm sorry.
I'm dirty. I'm so filthy. [sniffs]
We haven't much time. Come on.
We must hurry.
Here. See if these fit.
[Bogucki] We're going to have to keep moving you.
The Germans are hunting down indiscriminately now.
Jews, non-Jews, anybody, everybody.
And Wladek, you'd better shave. Use my razor on the shelf.
translation.it: Fatti la barba, usa il mio rasoio.

translation.en: You'll be looked after by Marek Gebczynski.
He's on the other side of town.
translation.it: Passerai la notte da lui, lontano da qui.

translation.en: You stay there tonight, then we'll find you somewhere else.
translation.it: Passerai la notte da lui, lontano da qui. Poi ti sposterai.

translation.en: -I'll bring you food. -Alright, let's go.
translation.it: Io porterò il cibo. Bene, andiamo.

translation.en: I'll show you where you're going to sleep.
You have to stay here until tomorrow afternoon.
translation.it: Resterai qui fino a domani pomeriggio.

translation.en: We have a flat for you near the ghetto wall. But it's safe.
translation.it: Avrai un appartamento vicino al ghetto. Ma è sicuro.

translation.en: It's not going to be very comfortable.
I'll be fine.
I'll take it. Here. Give it to me.
Go as near to the front as possible, to the German section.
translation.it: Mettiti il più vicino possibile ai tedeschi.

translation.en: [Gebczynski] I'm going to draw the curtains now.
But you leave them open during the daytime. Don't forget.
translation.it: Tu dovrai lasciarle aperte durante il giorno.

translation.en: Must feel better on this side of the wall, huh?
Yes.
But sometimes I'm still not sure which side of the wall I'm on.
translation.it: A volte credo di essere ancora dall'altro lato.

translation.en: [Gebczynski] Some bread, potatoes, onions.
translation.it: Qui ci sono pane, patate e cipolle.

translation.en: I'll come again. And Janina Bogucki will visit twice a week.
translation.it: Tornerò, e Janina verrà due volte alla settimana.

translation.en: Bring more food, see how you are.
Thank you.
Oh, this is very important. In case of emergency...
translation.it: Una cosa importante. Solo in caso di emergenza,

translation.en: I mean emergency, go to this address.
translation.it: Solo in caso di emergenza, va' a questo indirizzo.

translation.en: [woman playing kitten's voice next door] Puppy dog, what do you mean you forgot?
[man playing puppy dog's voice] What do you think I mean, Kitten? I forgot, that's what I mean.
translation.it: Sì, micetta, me ne sono dimenticato.

translation.en: [Kitten's voice] You know what, you treat me like dirt.
translation.it: Sai cosa? Tu mi tratti male!

translation.en: [Puppy dog's voice] I treat you like dirt because you are dirt.
-[Kitten's voice] Dirty pig! -[Puppy dog's voice] You are a dirty pig!
translation.it: - Sei un porco! - E tu una scrofa!

translation.en: [Kitten's voice] Takes one to know one. Pig.
[Puppy dog's voice] Hmm. You play like an angel, Kitten.
[Kitten's voice] If I play like an angel, why don't you listen? [Wladek chuckles]
[Puppy dog's voice] I was listening, Kitten.
[Kitten's voice] Liar! You fell asleep. Pig!
[gunshots, rapid gunfire]
[German soldier shouts in German]
[German soldier shouts in German]
[speaking German]
[speaking German] [sorrowful orchestral music continues]
translation.it: Raggruppateli, metteteli in riga e fate fuoco!

translation.en: [speaking German]
[soldier speaking German]
[sorrowful orchestral music continues]
[soldier shouts command in German]
Thank you.
-I wanted to come earlier, but... -No, no, no, thank you.
[Janina] No-one thought they'd hold out so long.
translation.it: Non credevamo che sarebbe durata tanto.

translation.en: I never should have come out. I should've stayed there and fought with them.
translation.it: Dovevo restare lì - e lottare con loro. - Wladek, smettila.

translation.en: Wladek, stop that. It's over now.
translation.it: - e lottare con loro. - Wladek, smettila. Ormai è finita.

translation.en: Just be proud it happened.
-My God, did they put up a fight! -Yes.
-So did the Germans. -They're in shock!
translation.it: Anche i tedeschi. Sono scioccati, nessuno se l'aspettava.

translation.en: They didn't expect it. Nobody expected it. Jews fighting back?
translation.it: Sono scioccati, nessuno se l'aspettava. Gli ebrei che reagiscono?

translation.en: -Who would have thought? -What good did it do?
translation.it: Chi l'avrebbe detto! Ma a cosa è servito?

translation.en: What good?
Wladek, I'm surprised at you.
They died with dignity, that's what good it did.
translation.it: A morire con dignità, a questo è servito.

translation.en: And you know something else?
Now the Poles will rise. We're ready.
translation.it: Anche noi polacchi insorgeremo. Siamo pronti, ora.

translation.en: We'll fight too. You'll see.
Get your things together. You have to leave.
translation.it: Prendi le tue cose. Devi andartene.

translation.en: p[Wladek] What? What's happened?
-[Gebczynski] I'm on the run. -What's happened?
The Gestapo found our weapons. They've arrested Janina and Andrzej.
translation.it: La Gestapo ci ha scoperti, hanno preso Janina e Andrzej.

translation.en: They're bound to find out about this place too. You must get away at once.
translation.it: Scopriranno anche questo posto, devi andartene.

translation.en: Where do you want me to go?
Look at me, I'm not leaving.
-Can I take my chances here? -That's your decision.
translation.it: Correrò il rischio. Libero di scegliere.

translation.en: But when they storm the flat, throw yourself out the window,
translation.it: Ma quando arriveranno... ...buttati di sotto, non lasciarti prendere.

translation.en: don't let them get you alive.
I have poison on me. They won't get me alive either.
translation.it: Nemmeno io lascerò che mi prendano vivo.

translation.en: [man speaking German]
[man speaking German]
[man speaking German]
[man speaking German] [door shuts]
[two men speaking to each other in German]
translation.it: Vi portiamo con noi. Forza, salite!

translation.en: [soldier speaking German]
[soldier speaking German]
[woman] Open up!
[woman shouts] Open this door at once or we'll call the police!
translation.it: Aprite la porta o chiamiamo la polizia!

translation.en: Are you from this flat? You're not registered.
translation.it: È lei che vive lì? Non è un inquilino.

translation.en: It belongs to a friend of mine. I just came to visit, but I must have just missed him.
translation.it: È di un mio amico, ero venuto a trovarlo.

translation.en: Have you got your identity card?
-Let me see your identity card. -Yes, of course.
-I want to see your identity card! -What's happening?
He's a Jew! A Jew!
Stop the Jew!
Don't let him out! Stop him!
-[Dorota] Yes? -Mr. Gebczynski sent me.
-Wladyslaw Szpilman. -Dorota.
Come in.
I'm sorry, I'm sorry.
I was given this address and I'm looking for a Mr. Dzikiewicz.
translation.it: Avevo quest'indirizzo. Cerco un certo Dzikiewicz.

translation.en: Michal Dzikiewicz, he's my husband.
Come in.
Sit.
I need help.
He'll be back before curfew.
I've... I've been in hiding.
-I need somewhere to stay. -He'll be here soon.
translation.it: Ho bisogno di un rifugio. Tornerà presto.

translation.en: -How long have you been married? -Just over a year.
translation.it: Da quanto sei sposata? Da un anno.

translation.en: And... how's Jurek?
Dead.
-And when, when is your baby due? -Christmas.
This is not a good time to have children, -[door opens, closes] -but then...
translation.it: Non è un buon momento per avere figli, lo so.

translation.en: This is my husband. Wladyslaw Szpilman.
translation.it: Lui è mio marito. Wladyslaw Szpilman.

translation.en: -Marek Gebczynski sent him. -Oh, yes, I remember.
translation.it: Lo manda Marek Gebczynski. Certo, mi ricordo.

translation.en: Mr. Gebczynski said to contact you only in case of emergency.
translation.it: Dovevo contattarla in caso di emergenza.

translation.en: Don't worry now.
We can't move you tonight. You'll sleep on the sofa.
Oh! Excuse me.
I'm sorry, could I, could I have a piece of bread?
translation.it: Potrei avere un pezzo di pane?

translation.en: Yes, of course. We'll eat.
Sit. Please, sit.
translation.it: Si segga, prego. Si segga pure.

translation.en: Thank you.
[Michal] You're in a very German area.
The building opposite is a hospital taking in wounded from the Russian front.
translation.it: Di fronte c'è l'ospedale per i feriti di guerra.

translation.en: And next door is the Schutzpolizei.
[Michal] Safest place to be.
Right in the heart of the lion's den.
I'll be locking you in.
No-one knows you're here, so keep as quiet as possible.
translation.it: Nessuno sa che sei qui. Devi restare in silenzio.

translation.en: All well?
Thank you.
This is Antek Szalas. He'll be looking after you.
translation.it: Questo è Antek Szalas. Si prenderà cura di te.

translation.en: -How do you do? -How do you do?
I've given him a second key. He'll bring you food, see that you're alright.
translation.it: Ha un doppione della chiave. Sarà lui a portarti il cibo.

translation.en: He's with the underground, he's a good man.
translation.it: È uno dei nostri, è un brav'uomo.

translation.en: -You don't remember me Mr. Szpilman? -I don't think so.
translation.it: Lei non si ricorda di me? Temo di no.

translation.en: Warsaw Radio. I was a technician.
translation.it: Lavoravo come tecnico alla Radio di Varsavia.

translation.en: [Szalas] I saw you almost every day.
-I'm sorry, I don't remember, I... -It doesn't matter.
translation.it: Mi dispiace, non ricordo. Non fa niente.

translation.en: You've nothing to worry about. I'll visit often.
translation.it: Non si preoccupi, verrò spesso a trovarla.

translation.en: You'll be pleased to hear that the Allies are bombing Germany...
night after night, after night.
Cologne, Hamburg, Berlin.
And the Russians are really giving them hell. It's the beginning of the end.
translation.it: I russi non gli danno tregua, la fine si avvicina.

translation.en: Oh, let's hope so.
Still alive then?
Here. Sausage, bread.
You still got that vodka?
-How long is this meant to last? -Not long now.
translation.it: Quanto mi deve durare? Non per molto.

translation.en: I think, I think I've got jaundice.
Don't worry about that. It just makes you look funny.
translation.it: Non preoccuparti, ti dà solo un colorito strano!

translation.en: My grandfather was jilted by his girlfriend when he got jaundice.
translation.it: Mio nonno fu scaricato dalla ragazza, quando ebbe l'itterizia.

translation.en: Drink up.
Why didn't you come sooner? It's been over two weeks.
-I got-- -Problems.
-Money. -[car door slams]
I've got to raise money to buy the food.
translation.it: Mi servono per comprare il cibo, dovrei vendere qualcosa.

translation.en: I need things to sell, it's not easy.
translation.it: Mi servono per comprare il cibo, dovrei vendere qualcosa. Non è facile.

translation.en: [Wladek] Here. Sell this.
Food's more important than time.
Oh, yes. I meant to tell you! The Allies have landed in France.
translation.it: Quasi dimenticavo. Gli alleati sono in Francia,

translation.en: Russians will be here soon.
translation.it: Gli alleati sono in Francia, e i russi stanno arrivando.

translation.en: They'll beat the shit out of the Germans...
any day now.
I knew it. I knew this would happen.
-I'll get a doctor. -You can't. It's too dangerous.
-I'll get Dr. Luczak. We can trust him. -Dorota. Don't be ridiculous,
translation.it: Andrò dal dottor Luczak. Ma è un pediatra!

translation.en: he's a pediatrician.
-He's still a doctor. -No.
You stay. I'll go.
We came to say goodbye.
We're going to stay with my mother in Otwocks.
translation.it: Andiamo da mia madre a Otwocks.

translation.en: The baby's already there. It's safer.
There's talk that the uprising will begin any day now.
translation.it: Dicono che l'insurrezione sia alle porte.

translation.en: That man Szalas should be shot.
He's been collecting money on your behalf all over Warsaw.
translation.it: Si è arricchito alle spalle degli ebrei a Varsavia.

translation.en: Apparently people gave generously, so he collected a tidy sum.
translation.it: Pare che la gente lo pagasse bene. Ha fatto un bel gruzzolo.

translation.en: My God.
The liver the size of a football. Acute inflammation of the gall bladder...
but he'll live.
I'll try to get him some levulose, but it's not easy.
translation.it: Gli procurerò del levulosio. Non sarà facile.

translation.en: -Can you visit him again? -Who knows.
translation.it: Tornerà a visitarlo? Non lo so.

translation.en: -Doctor, thank you. -Don't speak, rest.
We've brought you some food.
I'll prepare something now for you, then we must go.
translation.it: Ti preparo da mangiare, poi ce ne andiamo.

translation.en: [tram bell rings]
[man] Get out, get out, get out into the streets!
[man] Get out now! The Germans have surrounded the building!
translation.it: I tedeschi hanno circondato il palazzo!

translation.en: [Wladek] Somebody... Somebody! somebody help me!
[man # 1 speaking German]
[man # 2 speaking German]
translation.it: Sono al quarto piano! Non c'è niente qui!

translation.en: [both men speaking German]
-[man shouts] Heinrich? -[Heinrich speaking German]
translation.it: - Non sento niente! - Sono in soffitta!

translation.en: [Heinrich speaking German]
-[man shouts in German] -[Heinrich speaking German]
[German Captain in German] What are you doing here?
Who are you?
-Understand? -[in German] Yes.
[German Captain in German] What are you doing?
trying to open this can.
[in German] Do you live here?
[in German] Do you work here?
[Wladek in German] No.
[in German] What do you do?
[in German] I am...
I was a pianist.
Pianist?
[in German] Come on.
[in German] Play something.
[in German] Are you hiding here?
[in German] Jew?
[in German] Where are you hiding?
[in German] In the attic.
[in German] Show me.
[in German] Got any food?
-[German Captain speaking German] -[German Officers speaking German]
[in German] Jew!
Excuse me. Please.
[in German] What's all that gunfire?
[in German] Russians. Across the river.
translation.it: I russi sono dall'altro lato del fiume.

translation.en: [in German] All you have to do is wait a few weeks.
translation.it: Tra un paio di settimane sarà tutto finito.

translation.en: -[Wladek in German] What's happening? -[in German] We're leaving.
-[in German] Are the Russians here? -[in German] Not yet.
translation.it: Ci sono i russi? Non ancora.

translation.en: [in German] I... I don't know how to thank you.
[in German] Thank God, not me.
[in German] He wants us to survive. Well, that's what we have to believe.
translation.it: Lui ci ha fatti sopravvivere. Almeno, questo è ciò che dovremmo credere.

translation.en: [in German] Here. Take it.
-[in German] And you? -[in German] I've got another...
translation.it: E lei? Ne ho un altro.

translation.en: [in German] a warmer one.
[in German] What'll you do when it's all over?
translation.it: Che farà quando sarà tutto finito?

translation.en: [in German] I'll play the piano again. On the Polish radio.
translation.it: Tornerò a suonare il piano alla radio polacca.

translation.en: [in German] Tell me your name. [in German] I'll listen out for you.
translation.it: Mi dica il suo nome, così saprò chi ascolto.

translation.en: [in German] Good name for a pianist.
[woman shouts] German! German!
No! Don't shoot! I'm, I'm Polish!
-[gunshot] -Please! I'm Polish!
[Polish Officer shouts] Come out with your hands up!
Don't shoot, don't shoot, don't shoot. I beg you, I'm a Polish, please.
translation.it: Per favore, non sparate! Non sparate, sono polacco!

translation.en: [Polish Officer shouts] Come down!
Please, I'm Polish! Please... please.
[Polish Officer] He's Polish.
[Polish Officer #2] Yes, he's Polish.
[Polish Officer #2] Why the fucking coat?
I'm cold.
Look at them. German fuckers!
[Lednicki] Murderers! Murderers!
-Dirty bastards! -[Lednicki] Assassins!
-[Polish man] Bastards! -[Lednicki] Look at you now!
You took everything I had. Me, a musician.
translation.it: Vi siete presi tutto! Io, un musicista!

translation.en: You took my violin, you took my soul!
translation.it: Vi siete presi il mio violino, la mia anima!

translation.en: Musician?
[in German] Musician?
[in German] Do you know a pianist named Szpilman?
translation.it: Conosce... un pianista, il Signor Szpilman?

translation.en: [in German] Polish radio?
[in German] Of course I know him.
[in German] I helped him when he was in hiding. Tell him I'm here.
-[Russian Guard speaking Russian] -[Captain in German] Ask him to help me.
translation.it: Gli dica che sono qui. Gli chieda aiuto.

translation.en: [in German] What's your name? [German Officer] Hosenfeld.
-[in German] What? -[Russian Guard speaking Russian]
[Lednicki] It was here, I'm certain of it.
[Wladek] Well, it's not here now.
[Lednicki] I shouted, abuse at them. I'm not proud of it but that's what I did.
translation.it: Ho infierito contro di loro e non ne vado fiero.

translation.en: [Lednicki] And I'm certain I stood where you are now.
translation.it: Stavo proprio dove sei tu ora.

translation.en: [Lednicki] There was barbed wire, and this German came up to me.
translation.it: C'era il filo spinato quando gli ho parlato.

translation.en: -[Wladek] You didn't catch his name? -No.
translation.it: - Non hai sentito il nome, vero? - No.

translation.en: I'll ask at the factory. They may know something.
translation.it: Chiederò in fabbrica, forse lo sanno.
